frontmatter.description: Our second lesson on Accessibility focuses on multimedia - images, GIFs, videos, icons, and more! Learn more about how to meaningfully present visual media and content to all citizens of the Internet.
frontmatter.title: Multimedia

readingLinks.description: How do people with screen readers view emoji? Ashley Sheridan discusses how to make text and native emoji more accessible in HTML!
readingLinks.title: Ashley Sheridan - Emoji and Accessibility

readingLinks.description: Mozilla Developer Network has a great article on how to add multilanguage captions to videos!
readingLinks.title: Adding captions and subtitles to HTML5 video

readingLinks.description: An hour-long panel discussion that dives into the subject of accessibility difficulties. "It's too hard!" you may hear people say. If you've got the time, this video goes into a lot of detail and perspectives on accessibility as part of an engineering and agile environment.
readingLinks.title: Accessibility is too hard - Developer Edition (A11yTalks - December 2019)
